poem.title: Which Is Not How It Works
poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: She backs up, hits Send and blacks out, Banks on the redacted blanks Protecting her from blasts out of the blue. The bass, or sea-wolf, hunts in shoals That fishermen track like bats. They don't land the little brats with baited brass. Think how chitinous bracts cradle the bud. A chainsaw barks in the wood.
